sources.first_edition: 1785, Paris, Sieber: (Op. 33), no. 1 of Six quatuors pour deux violons, alto et basse composés par L. Boccherini oeuvre XXXIII. Prix 9s. à Paris, chez Sieber musicien, rue Honoré, la Porte Cochere entre les rues des vieilles Etuves et d'Orléans, n° 85. Plate no. 445.
later_editions: 1798, Paris, Pleyel: Op. 39 no. 2 (Book 1 no. 2; for title, see No. 234).

entries.notes: The first two bars are repeated in the Berlin and Rome MSS. Movement 4 is repeat of the minuetto followed by: Rondeau comodo assai sotto voce

partial_notes: Page shows complete entry 202 with footnote about Le Mercure de France February 1785 publication announcement
